title: Tell us: What’s the best New England town for a winter weekend getaway?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for the best New England town for a winter getaway.
Highlighted destinations include Boston, Nantucket, Sandwich, Woodstock, Bar Harbor, Portsmouth, Littleton, and Mystic.
Responses may be featured on Boston.com; submissions via online form or email are encouraged.

title: Boston ranks among best U.S. cities for Thanksgiving â€” and tops New England
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston ranked 18th in WalletHub's list of top 100 U.S. Thanksgiving destinations.
Boston was the only New England city in the top 100, boosted by its restaurant scene.
Boston scored highest for restaurants with Yelp ratings of 4.5+ stars and volunteering metrics.

title: Five years after debuting ‘Java with Jimmy,’ host James Hills isn’t slowing down
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: James 'Jimmy' Hills started 'Java with Jimmy' on Facebook to discuss COVID-19 impacts on communities of color in Boston.
Hills continues to influence Boston with his livestream, engaging with political figures and community leaders alike.
Hills aims to expand 'Java with Jimmy' into a larger platform for community organizing and hopes to establish a dedicated space.

title: Roman Anthony earns a third place finish for AL Rookie of the Year
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Roman Anthony of the Boston Red Sox finished third in the AL Rookie of the Year voting.
Oakland's Nick Kurtz won the award unanimously, with teammate Jacob Wilson taking second place.
Anthony played 71 games with a .292 average, 8 home runs, and was signed to an eight-year, $130 million extension.

title: Federal judge orders release of Fitchburg woman detained by ICE in viral video
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge in Maine ordered the release of Juliana Milena Ojeda Montoya detained by ICE in Fitchburg.
Ojeda Montoya, facing assault charges, was detained despite claims her detention violated due process rights.
Ojeda Montoya's husband alleged ICE agents caused him to experience a seizure during the arrest.

title: How Mass. lawmakers are reacting to the deal that could end the government shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts lawmakers criticize Senate's government funding bill for lacking health care subsidy extensions.
Rep. Seth Moulton calls for new Democratic leadership, questioning Sen. Chuck Schumer's effectiveness.
Gov. Maura Healey warns 330,000 Massachusetts residents face rising insurance costs without subsidy extension.

title: Boston firefighters battle 2-alarm blaze at multi-family home in Dorchester
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Fire Department tackled a two-alarm fire at a multi-family home on Train St. in Dorchester.
The fire displaced two residents and caused approximately $500,000 in damages.
One firefighter was hospitalized, and the cause of the fire is under investigation.

title: Here’s what Jon Stewart had to say about the Senate Democrats voting to end the shutdown
author: John Waller
bullets: Jon Stewart criticized Senate Democrats for their decision to vote to end the government shutdown.
Stewart remarked that the Democrats' move to conclude the shutdown was a significant failure.
The Senate initiated the process to halt the federal government shutdown on November 11, 2025.

title: Patrice Bergeron was asked about possible 2026 Hall of Fame induction
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patrice Bergeron, retired Bruins captain, discussed potential 2026 Hockey Hall of Fame induction but remained humble about his prospects.
Bergeron, a six-time Selke Trophy winner, retired in 2023 after 19 NHL seasons and two Olympic gold medals with Canada.
At teammates' Hall of Fame inductions, Bergeron emphasized his support for Zdeno Chara, Joe Thornton, and Duncan Keith.

title: Boston police ask for help in search for missing 15-year-old
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Briyana Jacques, 15, was last seen in Dorchester near Ashmont station and Blue Hill Ave. on Saturday.
Jacques is described as a Black female, 5'5", thin, with brown hair, blonde highlights, and a nose piercing.
Boston police urge anyone with information on Jacques' location to contact them at 617-343-4712 or call 911.
